item.title: Codification of French Administrative Law: Origins, Exploration, and Borrowing
item.description: Tianhao Chen Abstract The choice of the development path for codifying French administrative law can be traced back to a reevaluation of its traditional common law development path. In the early stages of administrative law development, the common law development path was capable of overcoming the normative dispersion of statutory law, filling gaps in statutory norms, and avoiding direct conflicts with administrative authorities. However, in the latter half of the 20th century, common law became increasingly incapable of meeting the demands for democracy and systematization.
